intro: Lithocardium paniculare, commonly known as the panicled lithocardium, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is distinguished by its showy, yellow-orange inflorescences that form dense, paniculate clusters. Lithocardium paniculare typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its botanical features make it a notable species in the study of African flora.
